title: Cat. 41  Fish Server, c. 1815
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Jean-Simon Chaudron (American, born France, 1758–1846)  
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania  
Silver and ivory; 3.8 × 27.9 × 7.6 cm (1 1/2 × 11 3/8 × 3 3/8 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society, 1970.2

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom of blade (fig. 41.1)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Private collection, New York, by 1969.

Sold by Parke-Bernet, 1969, lot 116.

With Robert Trump & Company, Philadelphia, by 1970.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1970.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Philadelphia Museum of Art, Philadelphia: Three Centuries of American Art, April 11–October 10, 1976, p. 248, cat. 206 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, The Antiquarian Society: The First One Hundred Years, April 23–June 19, 1977, p. 163, cat. 207 (ill).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">R. Davidson (1970), p. 332 (ill.).

Sewell and Foster (1976), p. 248, cat. 206 (ill.).

Tvrdik (1977), p. 163, cat. 207 (ill.).

Naeve (1978a), p. 25, fig. 32 (ill.).

Naeve (1978b), p. 741 (ill.).

Naeve et al. (1986), p. 163, cat. 207 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Fish Server, c. 1815.

fig. 41.1 </section>
